Name: Erotic harpist
Description: This small limestone figurine represents a harpist seated on a socle. Holding the harp against his body, the musician has his arms raised and his fingers at the strings. The piece is particularly distinguished by the enourmous phallus which is stretched between the extended legs  of the harpist. It is evident that the figurine must be placed in the context of eroticism and of fertility.
